measured_by: Motivation and Pleasure Scale – Self Report (MAP-SR)
justification: “To examine motivation and pleasure, participants completed the Motivation and Pleasure Scale (MAP-SR; Llerena et al., 2013).”
“Towards this goal we created a MAP-pleasure (MAP-P) which combined items 1-6 of the MAP-SR.”
“Motivational questions that made up MAP-motivation (MAP-M) factor (questions 10-15) included items such as ‘In the past week how motivated have you been…’.”

measured_by: Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale (CES-D)
justification: “we assessed depression symptoms using the Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale (CES-D; Radloff, 1977).”
“Participants completed a Running Span task to assess working memory… The outcome measure was the total number of correct letters recalled across all trials.”

measured_by: Two-stage decision-making task (Space Alien RL task)
justification: “In this task, MF learning encourages decision makers to stick with choices that were previously rewarded… Thus, MF learning should be indexed by a high likelihood of repeating first-stage choices when the previous trial was rewarded.”

measured_by: Two-stage decision-making task (Space Alien RL task)
justification: “MB learning involves considering contextual factors such as whether the rewarding outcome occurred following a spaceship choice that led to the common or rare planet… MB learning should be indexed by an interaction between reward and transition rarity.”
